website_summaries.verdict: A moderately-priced, versatile drip irrigation kit that is adaptable to a number of configurations.
pros: This complete kit includes 50 feet of tubing and a variety of emitters, stakes, and fixtures – over 160 pieces in all
The relatively easy set up requires no digging or plumbing experience and the nozzles can be individually adjusted to meet the specific needs of each plant
cons: When the temperature gets hot, the tubing can get soft, which may allow the emitters to pop off

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small garden!
customer_reviews.text: By far the best $25.99 I’ve ever spent. The instructions aren’t that great, but if you’re unable to figure it out without the instructions you’re better off just watering your garden with a hose. Easy to adjust, just twist the nozzle until it’s spraying how you want. I set mine to mist to optimize the pressure. Had to do a little tweaking at the end to get the pressure standard throughout, but as you can see by the video, it turned out great! **My garden is 8’x4’**
customer_reviews.author: Rivers Whitmire

customer_reviews.title: Mother Day Gift
customer_reviews.text: I brought this for Mother Day for my mother. A few days ago, my mother call me and said the irrigation system works well.
customer_reviews.author: Fangz

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Cost Effective
customer_reviews.text: My aunt started a small garden for me while she was in town for a few days. As I do not have a lot of time to spend in the yard, I wanted an automated watering system. This was quick to setup. It only took me 35 minutes or so to cut all the lines and install the drippers. Then another 5 minutes to get them all flowing at about the same rate. A great value for the price in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: M. VanMeter

customer_reviews.title: Great kit that has all the fittings and proper hose adapter.
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this kit when I received it. Plenty of parts and fittings to get the job done. Has the correct hose adapter that will connect to an outside hose bib faucet or garden hose. I found out that instead of warming the tubing in hot water I could use a hair dryer to soften the tubing for inserting the fittings. Hair dryer worked fine and was not as messy as a bowl of hot water. I plan to used Gorilla Glue to glue the fittings in the tubing so they don't loosen up in the heat of the summer sun. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Complete irrigation kit
customer_reviews.text: Great kit! Great price! Everything needed was in this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T York

customer_reviews.title: Easy to do.  Perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was absolutely perfect for me easily adapted to the system I already had
customer_reviews.author: m davis

customer_reviews.title: ONE OF THE WORST PRODUCTS IN HISTORY.
customer_reviews.text: The hose that comes with this package is ABSOLUTELY, JUNK!! About a year and a half ago, I spent countless hours running this throughout the yard to every plant, and it's been nothing but hassle since. As soon as the weather gets warm the hose stretches/expands and the connections come off. I constantly (once or twice a week) have to figure out why where the new failure is and fix it using some 1/4 clamps that I ended up buying separately. This thing completely defeats the purpose of automating your irrigation. Do yourself a favor, and buy the Rain Bird hose. That one doesn't expand under the sun and lasts MUCH longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amir S

customer_reviews.title: Must have for anyone with a garden
customer_reviews.text: This what's exactly what I needed and a little more
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, just not enough tubing for even a small greenhouse.
customer_reviews.author: jsmitty

customer_reviews.title: Very practical, the installation is very simple, and there are many varieties!
customer_reviews.text: Very practical, the installation is very simple, and there are many varieties!
customer_reviews.author: Wei Jia

customer_reviews.title: System works perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drip set for a small vegetable garden. This set is easy to install and works perfectly. I am now able to distribute the correct amount of water to each plant simply by adjusting the flow rate on each drip head. Once the initial adjustments were done, all I have to do is turn on the water. This set is also expandable. Feels good to know that I can add to it and move the pieces around if the layout of my garden changes. There are no cons to purchasing this drip set.
customer_reviews.author: David Holstein

customer_reviews.title: Works Like A Charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! I have this system in my garden, watering 9 tomatoes, and several types of squash. It cones with everything you need, and plenty of parts. I could triple my garden size, and still have leftover water line and emitters. Very worth the $20 I spent, as all I have to do is hook up my hose and walk away. No more walking around, watering one plant at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: it was very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I should have tried one of these systems a long time ago. it was very easy to install. I looked at the pictures and that is all I needed to set it up to water my flowers and vegetables. I have found the quick connect faucet online separately so I can use the leftovers for another area. The quick connect I found online is a little pricey compared to the more standard faucet connection.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Southern Woman of a Certain Age

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing. I purchased in hopes this would somewhat create ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Absolutely amazing. I purchased in hopes this would somewhat create an alternative to buying a motor to increase my rain barrel's pressure, since a standard hose would not work. I connected all parts (And followed directions) and created a drip irrigation system from my rain barrel. AMAZING! This came with a plentiful amount of pieces to get the job done, and extras in case a repair may be needed (which i doubt).
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Herrera

customer_reviews.title: great package. I was able to use almost all ...
customer_reviews.text: great package. I was able to use almost all the items and it has enough of everything where i could set up atleast 10 flower pots. had to buy splitters from Lowes to attach to the sprinkler system.
customer_reviews.author: willworkforoil

customer_reviews.title: Over all good product
customer_reviews.text: Well priced, good quality, instruction could be made a little more detailed (over simplified) but a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Learning curve but it works well
customer_reviews.text: I put several of these to use on two new flowerbeds, hooked up to a sprinkler timer. It took some experimenting and trial and error, plus a few accessories, but the system works perfectly now. One tip: If you are covering more than 10 plants or so, it's better to split the connection at the hose and have multiple adapters or starting points. The flow through the black tubing starts to become uneven after too much distance, so I used several garden hose splitters and started a new tube every 10 plants. The system has great pressure throughout now, I'm watering about 50 plants from one faucet.
customer_reviews.author: AMM

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It’s working well on my home garden. It was a little difficult to put together because the instructions were slightly confusing but once we got it all together and everything on tight (at first the water pressure was pushing the sprayers out of the tubing), I havent had any more issues.
customer_reviews.author: Boatman

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble but do t know why they give you 20 pieces because I have 12 heads hooked up and the water doesn’t reach the end ones and drips out of the others except the first one. Water pressure seems fine, even drilled out the connector a little with no luck. There was no way to contact seller so I have to write this review. Definitely not as advertised. This is a small garden bed about 10’ long. I added more connections because water was t reaching plants. This is a waste of $25. I do not recommend for gardens, maybe a couple potted plants
customer_reviews.author: Rjg

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to water my garden in 7 planters. I put a row with 7 spray nozzles and a row with 7 soakers. If I turn on the spray nozzles nothing will come out of the soakers. If I use just the soakers the first nozzles are over watering and nothing comes out of the last no matter how I adjust them. Will have to buy Something else to water my garden.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Only problem I have had is the connections at either the drip or spray nozzles sometimes pop off, not the same one either different nozzles and believe me I made sure the fitting was fully into the tubing . Other wise this so far is a time saver and keeps my plants growing.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory K.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, not worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Installed the "irrigation system" right after receiving it. To say that I was surprised by the lack of quality in the parts would be an understatement. While it has only been a week or so, some of the heads have already broken. The 1/4" tube, while advertised as flexible and easy to assemble, I found to be brittle and had very little flexibility. Perhaps long term it will prove to be useful, but from what I have experienced so far extremely unlikely.
customer_reviews.author: DRC

customer_reviews.title: Plan your layout in advance for a successful installation.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife who, admittedly, does not have a green thumb. Until now! This irrigation system was reasonably easy to install, as long as you plan your layout in advance, and acclimate yourself with the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Connections leak like crazy. Worthless!
customer_reviews.text: The o-ring quick connection leak like crazy. No matter how many times I installed the hose connectors using different Teflon tapes and torque rates, the adapters would leak like crazy. The problem seems to be with the o-ring quick snap-on connection, it’s just to too cheap. I guess if you turn the hose on/off each day to water your plants, you can live with wasting a lot of water. Eventually, the adapter just snapped in half. Worthless. WARNING: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: MikeM

customer_reviews.title: Works as described and is easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I'm a landscaper and I Bought this system for some lipstick palms I have. It was easy to set up and gave sufficient water to all my plants. I paired it with an automatic timer and its hassle free. Been using it for two months with no issue, if this changes in the coming months I'll do an update.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Could have used more tubing
customer_reviews.text: I like all of the options that came with this set. But for all of the parts and pieces, it needs more tubing. This worked for my needs in my small garden. I will end up having to buy extra tubing if I want to use the rest of the kit.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cotton

customer_reviews.title: Good stand-alone with a starting point for a larger install
customer_reviews.text: Got this to water a few hanging baskets on my porch. Works very well and provides a large assortment of extra parts should you decide to expand in the future. My only complaint is that, after a few weeks' usage of about 20 minutes a day in the evening, the black tubing has started to pop off the connector that goes onto my garden hose. I have my system on a timer, so I don't know if it's the sudden rush of water pressure that does it or if the tube is just worn-out. It's nothing that couldn't be worked around with some glue to hold it on though.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Matherly

customer_reviews.title: good starter kit
customer_reviews.text: First attempt on installing/using drip irrigation on my raised veggie beds. Big time (have it on a timer) and water savings.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I'll admit to not being great at remembering to water my plants. This system was easy to install came with a lot of options and supplies and works great. I added a timer so my planters will be good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth L

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality hose and connectors. Barb fittings hold the hose tight. Super easy to setup and well worth the money. Used this to setup an automated watering system for potted plants outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Can't connect to water hose faucet.
customer_reviews.text: This irrigation system is quite complete and once you get it installed it's worth the effort. The only complaint I have is the connector that should screw onto where your water hose was isn't the correct thread. There is no way you can connect to a water hose faucet with the included adapters. Had to go to Lowes and get an adapter for $1.95 which worked perfectly. Other than that it does what its supposed to. Hence the less than perfect review.
customer_reviews.author: Road Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price and size. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how well it works for the price and for the size. It’s a great light weight system for plants.
customer_reviews.author: Professor Libro

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kit
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up, and plenty of hose to do multiple runs in a planter
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Iglesias

customer_reviews.title: Quick and simple.
customer_reviews.text: This kit was complete and came with good instructions. It was easy to set up and works as designed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Burkett

customer_reviews.title: Flantor Garden Irrigation System
customer_reviews.text: I combined this with another system and everything worked well. What I like is the various heads for the lines, some drip, some spray and some give more water than just a drip. Basically a good buy when you have an existing system and timer
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: T connectors are worthless
customer_reviews.text: The "T" connectors only have barbs on 2 ends. This causes the tubing to pop off, resulting in the rest of your system not getting water. I had to buy some from rainbird that would not pop off. The emitters were also pretty worthless, when I tried to adjust them some fell apart and I ended up using different ones as well.
customer_reviews.author: Busloadofhypocondriacs

customer_reviews.title: Not for a hose!
customer_reviews.text: The included attachment does not hook to a standard garden hose. You will need a separate adapter i guess. The included adapter almost fits but it's not the correct thread for American hoses. It pulls straight out and can only be cross threaded. The idea is great and I wish I could hook it to my hose. But it's unreliable and I used the universal spout fitting tip connect to my hose and it lasted 2 days before it blew apart and only soaked the area where it was connected. Everything else seems to work good. As long as you're not using a garden hose you should be ok with this product.
customer_reviews.author: joshsmonster

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: The installation is relatively simple and I should see how durable the irrigation will be over time. Here are my comments: 1- I found it very odd to learn that drippers cannot be connected to the T connections directly?! Like atomizing nozzles, we should be able to connect them directly to the T connections. 2- There was no instruction in package?! I had to go to Amazon product page to learn about installation. 3- There are 20 end closure connections. Every irrigation jobs doesn't need more than 2-3 of them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good in Theory
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes, but reality is different. Two main issues: Tubing pops off. Fresh cut tube, inserted past shoulder of barb. However, tubing pops off barb every so often. Had this happen on 4 separate occasions which isn't so great with an automated watering system. Second issue is that tubing is too restrictive. My setup has 3 main trunks with 18 locations for watering total. I get a drip from each... 1/4" tubing seems like it is way too restrictive for the setup. May be good for a small setup that is supervised during use...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this if you plan on using on outside American faucets.
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this item as it does not fit standard American outdoor faucets. Thankfully, I had not spent a ton of time setting it up before I found out but it ruined my kids day since that was our big project for their garden and they were excited about it. Not sure what possessed them to not include an exterior faucet connector...
customer_reviews.author: Big Walt

customer_reviews.title: It looks great, but not so great after turning on the water...
customer_reviews.text: The kit looks comprehensive with a universal garden hose drip connector. However, 1) the universal garden hose drip connector does not work with the garden hose outlet (the thread does not match). 2) the diagram for the product on Amazon does not look right. It shows the "adjustable dripper" connects to the "barbed tee" directly. How could that be? 3) Had borrowed a garden hose converter from my gardener, and connected this kit with one adjustable dripper with the city water out of my garden hose outlet. Using only small water flow, the connecting barbed tee started leaking and eventually burst open. Now I do not know what to do with this kit.
customer_reviews.author: a user

customer_reviews.title: Super Happy
customer_reviews.text: I'll be a return customer. This is great!!! Especially for the cost. I think it made an amazing difference in my garden. It was fun to set up, and a point of pride seeing all my little sprinklers sprinkling. It'll need tweaking at first to make the connections sturdy. I found gently heating the tubing with a lighter would make a good seal, and don't turn the water pressure too high.
customer_reviews.author: jessica zimmermann

customer_reviews.title: Good irrigation system for vegetable
customer_reviews.text: I finally squeezed time to set up my irrigation system. I’m happy with the design and product quality. It’s easy to setup and adjust without any part broken. I use it for my cucumber, pepper and tomato. So far, it’s been working perfectly. It saved my watering time and I believe it will reduce my water cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I used this drip system for a flowerbed. It was easy to install however the water doesn’t reach the farthest of the beds. The closer to the faucet the more water
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the time or money
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so my husband was so excited to get this irrigation system. It took forever to set it up in the garden. We wanted the drip system, not the spray. The stakes were pretty much useless because the hose kept coming lose. We only used it a few times, because I got tired of adjust nearly every one of the heads. Wish i could give it more stars, but i don't even want to use it again next year; hopefully my husband will let me throw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This setup is AWESOME!!!!! I use to have soaker hoses setup and they would always give me problems,springing big leaks,bursting,wouldn’t soak at the end of the hose, had to restrict the pressure differently for each setup. I purchased 2 of the Flanter setups, and all I can say is AWESOME. So easy to setup just connect to my hose, run the main line , cut where I wanted the lines to run,attach, and done. Best thing, with the hose adapter, I can just run my faucet at full pressure with no issues..
customer_reviews.author: Steven P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gardens on timers!!
customer_reviews.text: This kit had everything I was looking for at a great price!! It also had items I wasn't aware needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absurdly Bad
customer_reviews.text: This product is unusable. I am shocked that it is still being sold and hasn't been reported as a scam. 1. The "universal" hose adapter does not even fit a standard faucet. I set everything up and couldn't even connect. 2. The drip spickets, which are the items I needed to use, were not the right size for. Any. Single. Other. Part. What even is the point if pieces don't fit together? 3. The tubing pops off of the parts really easily. I am not happy at all. This was a waste of time and money. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: William Cambra

customer_reviews.title: You need more than what comes in product to make it work.
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving this product a C or 3/5. The directions should be more detailed than just the pictures provided for beginners and should also state the extra supplies you need; 1 Does not fit American garden faucet so had to buy adapter. 2 also need a pressure regulator so the sections don’t burst apart. Also, make sure your cuts are straight and you push the hose piece down all way on adapter to help prevent hose seperating/bursting.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Mamik

customer_reviews.title: Fitting joints may leak.
customer_reviews.text: Using this for drip irrigation in my veg garden. If you use this product, leave extra tubing in each fitting joint for excess when cutting off tubing to re-couple leaky joints. 5-10% of joints will leak after a few weeks so do not cut tubing exactly to length, will need excess to cut old tubing joints out.
customer_reviews.author: nc25

customer_reviews.title: More than enough pieces
customer_reviews.text: I have it watering 10 hanging baskets and it works great! Could have more tubing and another hose connector to make use of more of the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Ehh I guess
customer_reviews.text: First things first. Irrigation is hard. Well it seems like it would be. This product is very OK. It is cheap and the pieces are cheap as well. I have read plenty of reviews on what is in the box so I am not going to do that. I will say for a very small project this is fine but for anything more substantive it is not going to work well for you as obviously the hose is 1/4" and the components are tiny. I mean toy tiny. Enjoy your miniature garden~!
customer_reviews.author: MarkandTina

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work well in a hot climate.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I don’t have to water my garden by hand, but living in the south, it gets really hot. Heads continually popping off and even the hose to the connector. All summer I was snipping and reinserting hoses and heads after seeing plants not get watered. Not to mention watering isn’t even all the way to the end. I do use a pressure regulator and played with having the water from all the way up to down as low as possible while still watering. After giving it a whole season, I say this is too much hassle.
customer_reviews.author: cros4t

customer_reviews.title: Cannot get hose connector to work with tubing
customer_reviews.text: There are no clear directions only photos of the atomizing nozzle assembly. I wanted to use the drip feature and it took me a few trail and errors to figure it out. Once I did it was smooth sailing, following other customers advice to dip tubing in boiling water to make it easier to attach. AND then I turned the faucet on! Complete failure. The tube came off every time I turned on the hose, they tube could handle the water pressure. I attached a photo of the hose connector I used. Maybe another customer has some ideas how I can salvage this, since the company does not provide written instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Szymczak

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gadget!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this gadget!! He installed this hoping to keep our rose bushes alive/ hydrated before we went on vacation for a week with no idea if it will work or not... It surely did its purposes!! All my roses were still alive and it still is till this day..
customer_reviews.author: Duffy the Bear

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this junk
customer_reviews.text: The quality of parts is terrible. One head will shoot water 2 feet in the air when the sprayer head is off, the next one in line barely dribbles out water. I think the holes in the parts vary considerably. It is completely impossible to get uniform water flow out the the 15 heads that I installed. Back to soaker hoses.
customer_reviews.author: James Franzen

customer_reviews.title: The best watering system!!!
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love this. I used to have to water my garden every night now all I have to do is turn on the hose from about 30 mins and let it do its thing. This is perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Buscemi

customer_reviews.title: Very good price. Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Very good price. Easy to assemble. A monkey could do it. Added a cheap orbit timer..now watering my 15 plants on back porch is a breeze. Great buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Munsell

customer_reviews.title: do not buy this cheap POS
customer_reviews.text: the parts are so cheap they will not work with any decent water pressure. the hose is nowhere near the quality required to withstand average water pressure. MAYBE if you live in a colder climate, but the hose is very flimsy which technically makes it easier to connect the pieces. but it sacrifices the strength and gets even worse when the summer heat comes along because the heat makes the hose even weaker. the connector parts are ok quality and havent failed yet, but the red sprinkler parts do not work well. some didnt work at all. I regret buying this entirely.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this irrigation kit hoping for the best but not expecting it to work well. Boy was I wrong! This kit rocks. I have 8 drippers watering tomato plants on a garden hose timer. Kit had everything needed and more. Dont let the price fool you as it did me. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F.

customer_reviews.title: Why give drippers if you can’t connect more than 1?
customer_reviews.text: So....This set comes with drippers and a limited information instruction manual(thank you China made product. million Ex pats from the US and other English speaking countries and god forbid you hire anyone to translate). Can you please tell me how the hell I'm suppose to connect the drippers? This is pretty much and atomizing set. You can only use the atomizers or one dropper at the end of a tube. There diverters only connect to the hose and atomizers. Don’t include the drippers and get us more Fixed Rods. Or, give us a connector that splits and connects to the drippers
customer_reviews.author: vasilis nicos petrou

customer_reviews.title: Product contents are OK, not really drip nozzles though.
customer_reviews.text: Product contents are OK, if you want one type such as only drip or atomizer this won't have all the parts and eventually I had to punch holes in the tubing to get the spread i wanted. the "drip" nozzles are really sprinkler heads on a small scale and not drip emitters. The connection for the hose rusts which means you can't really use it outside or anywhere that there is moisture.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Unless you wanna stand there
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE! I do not like this system I’ve had for a few months and it’s junk. The whole system just keeps popping off at the connects fix one and another blows off. Even with barely turning the Spicket barely on it just blows off. Not happy with this product at all I’m giving up on it and using a water hose cause I gotta stand out there anyway to watch the lines and fix them.... MY FIRst look at it Ok so i bought this for my garden and man it’s a lot easier to set up than the one I got from a different store. This works very well
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Product works really well
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Easy to adjust the drip rate; only issue I had was inserting the drip units into the hose. The hose does not stretch so you need to muscle them into place. I would recommend the purchase of a faucet timer, which I ended up buying at HD.
customer_reviews.author: modigliani

customer_reviews.title: Amazing, I'm absolutely satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Large assembly of connectors, drippers, sprinklers. Easy to install (when connecting the hoses warm up the end of the hose in hot water) and very versatile. Here in San Diego I have to water my plants almost daily, despite the miserable weather at the moment. I added a solenoid valve and a wifi outlet and now all it takes is "Alexa, turn on the Irrigation" for altogether less than 40 $.
customer_reviews.author: Dominik Wosiek

customer_reviews.title: easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I installed this irrigation system after I have done with my flower bed. It took me 15 min to assemble them, very easy to locate every nozzle, you can adjust the length between your plants. My flower bed is 24ft long, so the last nozzle has lower pressure than others. Anyway, it's good stuff, worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: QiChao Li

customer_reviews.title: The tubing burst
customer_reviews.text: Overall a nice starter kit. Probably a lot more drippers and misters than an average person needs. I think the tubing is not uniform in its thickness. Some parts go on to the barbs very easily, and then pop off when you turn on the water. Other parts are impossible to put on to the barb. I had to file the barbs down a bit to get it to go in. The disappointment came 2 days later, when the tubing burst, and everything in my yard was irrigated for half a day.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great product, made our life much easier
customer_reviews.text: We own two homes; therefore, watering the plants is an issue when we are not there. I installed this in 30 minutes on 6 plants. I did have to go to Home Depot and get more tubing, 50' was not enough and they did not offer more. I also bought the timer separately. This works beautifully. Now we watch our plants being watered instead of filling a bucket several times.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Time saver
customer_reviews.text: Super fast shipping. Now if I can figure out how to set it up. Shouldn’t be too bad because the instructions are pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Tim M.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very valid alternative to a drip system with underground pipes. A couple of points that could be improved: - Rubber hose is really hard to connect to the plastic junctions. In order to have it go down all the way, twisting and applying lots if pushing is required - Hose anchor to the ground are poor quality. I ended up buying heavy duty stakes instead Apart from those points it’s fairly easy to install and works beautifully
customer_reviews.author: Stefano E.

customer_reviews.title: Good for use
customer_reviews.text: This flantor garden irrigation system is perfect, let our land become very wet, and is easy for use, have all accessories , the water pipe longer, I can use lager land. Good!
customer_reviews.author: Hao Wu

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t stay together
customer_reviews.text: None of the tees are holding so when I turn on my garden (which I spent 8 hours setting up) the joints blow apart. Not only did I spend money on this kit but I bought extra hoses, tees and drip ends so I’m out about 100 bucks. Not worth the money at all. Hoping for a full refund
customer_reviews.author: Jalisa Butler

customer_reviews.title: Good watering system
customer_reviews.text: It took me a couple of hours to set up my watering system. 5 flower pots, 3 bonsai, and a flower bed. The quality of the pipe and tubing is superb, very durable. I think it can withstand sunlight and weather here. I am able to control the dripper to the amount of water I want depends on flowers and bonsai. I am going to get a timer now. Hesitate to get one before making sure this system works. I guess it's time now. Happy gardening!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Using with an indoor herb and houseplant automatic watering system.
customer_reviews.text: Using with an indoor herb and houseplant automatic watering system. Work great and seem pretty durable. Fittings can be tight and I couldn't figure out a good way to use the sprinkler head with the included stakes. Stakes hold the tubing horizontal, sprinkler head needs to be vertical.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: How do you mess this up?
customer_reviews.text: You sell a kit for easy watering, but the "quick connectors" don't even fit a standard water hose? Kind of lost touch with your whole purpose didn't you? Now the thing is all cut up and ran to my plants and I can't even turn the dumb thing on. I'll throw it all in a muddy box and send it back.
customer_reviews.author: CarlDon

customer_reviews.title: Ea
customer_reviews.text: Instructions could be better on the different attachments and their uses but I ordered two sets and I love them once figures out. Makes it so much easier in my flower beds instead of dragging a 100 ft hose around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Sissy

customer_reviews.title: Water spray
customer_reviews.text: Very complete, direct interface to the automatic sprinkler interface, the length of the water pipe is cut with scissors, the water outlet can adjust the amount of water spray.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Good system that is fairly easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together. Plenty of parts to do just about any setup you would like. Took away one star because the atomizers and dippers have different connections which can be a little confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Nies

customer_reviews.title: Very Efficient and Beneficial
customer_reviews.text: Multiple accessories helped lessen the work for me. It has everything I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Piter

customer_reviews.title: Components Not Compatible With Each Other
customer_reviews.text: This product has a supply tubing that is too small in diameter for the connectors. It is impossible to assemble the system correctly and if you are able to get it together, like I was, the tubing just separates from the connectors. This is not the first irrigation I have used and purchased a Raindrip system at the same time which installed and performs perfectly, so I do know what I doing. Save yourself the disappointment and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: 👍 nice
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for front flower beds! Love this set. I needed a lot of tubbing to cover all around my backyard and front. This was able to extend water out from my main tubes to reach my newly planted flowers. The only thing you need to control preasure of water you giving and based on it you can extend this equipment. I would recommend to keep maybe 3 or 4 max output per line.Overall, it can be used for multiple purposes, and can meet the needs of watering.
customer_reviews.author: Lana, Texas

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: This package makes it seem like it has everything you need and should be easy to use, especially for a novice gardner like myself. Honestly if you can go to a local sprinkler supply store (more common than you might think) and they’ll actually give you direction you need and give exactly what you need and talk you through how to make it all work. Home Depot has everything you need as well so don’t waste your time and money on this package.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmo

customer_reviews.title: Quirky but good
customer_reviews.text: This is a good overall product. However, it does leak after a couple uses right where it connects onto the faucet. Also it was really hard to install the first time... The tines didn’t match up to go on our hose. It was really strange, but my husband had to carve it out with a knife to get it to fit. Otherwise it works great to water our garden while we are on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Niqua

customer_reviews.title: Kit  as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: More than enough parts to get the job done. Tubing is a bit stiff in regards to put fitting on the tube. Would not like to do it on a chilly day. The only missing component is a end plug. I used an unused sprinkler head and cranked down the flow. Else all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Duce

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, went together easy, good price, just needed more tubing to go farther
customer_reviews.author: JOEnT

customer_reviews.title: As described, not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Overall, product is as described. But the 1/4” line prevents enough water pressure to properly work mister heads. Would need a larger line to allow for more water for them to work correctly. They just dribble. Other heads provide lots of water! Fairly easy to put together. Package does not provide enough line to use all components that come with it. Overall, good price, needs a few tweaks to be better but the greenhouse veggies get water.
customer_reviews.author: BLY

customer_reviews.title: Crappy Shipping
customer_reviews.text: EVERYTHING IS WET. Boxes are soggy and contents! Is just a few more steps to the front door where it could’ve been safe from the rain!
customer_reviews.author: Eric J Coker

customer_reviews.title: Make your life easier
customer_reviews.text: I love the material of the hose, the tubes are more effective than those that throw rain than those that enter the pots because as you get farther from the tube they lose power, the package brings many materials, more not hoses, but with what It brings you a great opportunity to work in your garden, in our case we had to buy an additional hose, but it came out in the recommended options, which helped us enough
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss
customer_reviews.text: Had one installed last year and worked very well. Moved to new home, purchased again and installed. However, this time it was hard to fit the fittings together. Now the fittings are becoming loose everyday at different spots making it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jeteye

customer_reviews.title: Not really worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 sets of these. The stakes are worthless. They are so flimsy that they won’t stick into anything harder than soft butter. Rocks of any kind or soil that isn’t saturated, prohibit sticking into the ground. The piping and the fittings are very difficult to push together and if forced the sprinkler piece will break.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Light Duty, Not For Raised Beds
customer_reviews.text: This is a very light duty product. It didn’t come with a pressure regulator or filter, so you have to figure out the correct setting on your faucet and hope nothing clogs up the line or heads. Because it’s just one long run of narrow rubber pipe, you’ll have pressure issues toward the end of the line. I’m not sure who this is for, but definitely not good for raised beds tapping into an outside spigot. Ultimately had to trash this and go with a sturdier product.
customer_reviews.author: Pacificus

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Really like these kits. Sprinkling wasn't working and plants were struggling. Put these in and boy the plants took off and the system works effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Will consider buying again for my other garden.
customer_reviews.text: Keep in mind. You may need a pressure regulator for this product. I had one already so I used it. I like the fact that I get 40 nozzels. Would have liked them all to be drip ones but I can make them all work. For the price it is hard to beat. This is a 50 foot kit, something I didn't realize at first since I was searching for 100 ft kits. But overall I am happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Boyd Jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy & Complete
customer_reviews.text: This is an easy watering system. It is a very easy system to assemble. What it says it to do it does. I am living in Mexico & it arrived without a problem. There is not too much to the system. It will adjust the water to your needs. What it says it is, it does.
customer_reviews.author: James Springer

customer_reviews.title: It is what it says
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected, can't wait to see what it works like...
customer_reviews.author: Bogdan Paun

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! I have this system in my garden, watering 9 tomatoes, and several types of squash.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie-fang

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a fair price!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time using an irrigation system of any sort. I found it easy to set up in my garden bed for my tomatoes. I also use an automatic water timer with this so now I have my auto watering set up when I leave my house and I couldn't be more excited! We often travel for holidays and I have had to ask family members to come water my plants but that will no longer be a worry for me!
customer_reviews.author: Gaia11

customer_reviews.title: Great kit with lots of options
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awesome for putting together an irrigation system. I used this to do an overhead spray system for my vegetable garden. I’m a little disappointed in how the red sprinkle heads worked (they just sort of drip heavily instead of spreading out), but this could be due to the lower pressure I need to use. However, the adjustable orange spray heads are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan P.

customer_reviews.title: Only first 3 drippers get enough pressure
customer_reviews.text: it's not easy to install but it's doable, the problem is that only first 3 drippers work, after that almost no pressure. Somebody recommended to install pressure regulator to lower pressure, tried that and it's got even worse. If you have a very small garden then it might be OK but if you intend to use the whole length you may encounter the same problems
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Kocha

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 beds, each with their own feed line. I was hoping that i can use the tips from this to tap into the feed lines and use the hosing+nozzles to feed the beds. Not the case. These cannot tap a line. I had to manually tap. Still after the tap there is no seal. I guess for a single bed one kit would be fine but for 4 beds I would need 4 kits.
customer_reviews.author: GAP

product_meta.title: Flantor Garden Irrigation System, 1/4" Blank Distribution Tubing Watering Drip Kit/DIY Saving Water Automatic Irrigation Equipment Set for Garden Greenhouse, Flower Bed,Patio,Lawn
feature_bullets: - Water all your plants at one time. After installing Gadgetmann Watering Equipment, all you need to do is turn on the tap when you need.
- Water your plants every day automatically (need a timer NOT INCLUDED) when you are on a business trip or during your travel.
- Save you from bothering your neighbors to help you take care of your plants when you are away.
-Every nozzle could be adjust individully, it can meet the water demand of different plants at one time.
- Simple installation without digging or plumbing skills. Easy installation with a manual with picture.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars1,102 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
